content:
At the close of the review ballot the responsible Work Group (WG) shall capture all comments using the
HL7 Ballot Reconciliation Report unless the WG has petitioned for and been granted a waiver of such
use by the Technical Steering Committee (TSC).

Is this the case (waiver) for Jira ballot process?

(I'm reading the GOM, can you tell ;-))
that is why the reconciliation report function exists in jira ballot definition as well
too new to have granted anyone a waiver and exercised the petition process yet

I see a way to generate a reconciliation sheet for https://jira.hl7.org/browse/BALDEF-1979 which used the new process, but not for SMART Web Messaging (https://jira.hl7.org/browse/BALDEF-1900) which predates it -- where should I go to read up on the process for putting a reconciliation report together this spec (ideally leveraging all the reconciliations we've done in Jira)?
(Also, is the ballot desktop down? http://www.hl7.org/ctl.cfm?action=ballots.home crashes for me.)
oh rats, I "ignored" the parsed files in sourcecontrol and broke something. I'll get with Eric to fix
For BALDEF-1900, click on Workflow, then Reconcilation sheet

That gives me a spreadsheet of comments but not the equivalent of:

image.png

(Assume this will be available in the ballot desktop once that's back up, and that it's out of scope for Jira on older ballots like SMART Web Messgaing?)
ballot tallies are still on the ballot desktop as the "current" or "final" counts
which is, by the way, back up.
I ran a re-tabulate for you, but because only voters that submitted comments are represented in Jira, the Jira count is not super useful
